lender.name: Colette
lender.loan_because: The first two loans I made were a birthday gift to my son, Julian, who lives a loving life and cares deeply about peace and justice. My wish is to help create a peaceful world by helping others become self-sufficient and prosperous.
lender.occupational_info: I am a mother of three; my twin sons are doctoral students in chemistry and my daughter is an undergraduate in chemistry and plans to go to medical school to become an emergency and disaster relief surgeon. She will travel to Ghana this January as a volunteer for Unite for Sight. I teach reading and writing to 2nd and 3rd grade bilingual students.

lender.name: Meredith
lender.loan_because: My sister and I have traveled to over 60 countries in the past thirty years. My heart is in Africa. God has blessed me and I want to share these blessings with others.

What goes around comes around; people have helped me, and it is something I always remember, now it is my turn. The world needs more kindness.
“Give, and it shall be given to you. For whatever measure you deal out to others, it will be dealt to you in return.”
“Charity shall cover the multitude of sins” (i like bible quotes, :) )
adapted from The Star Thrower by Loren Eiseley (1907 - 1977)
Once upon a time, there was a wise man who used to go to the ocean to do his writing. He had a habit of walking on the beach before he began his work.
One day, as he was walking along the shore, he looked down the beach and saw a human figure moving like a dancer. He smiled to himself at the thought of someone who would dance to the day, and so, he walked faster to catch up.
As he got closer, he noticed that the figure was that of a young man, and that what he was doing was not dancing at all. The young man was reaching down to the shore, picking up small objects, and throwing them into the ocean.
He came closer still and called out "Good morning! May I ask what it is that you are doing?"
The young man paused, looked up, and replied "Throwing starfish into the ocean."
"I must ask, then, why are you throwing starfish into the ocean?" asked the somewhat startled wise man.
To this, the young man replied, "The sun is up and the tide is going out. If I don't throw them in, they'll die."
Upon hearing this, the wise man commented, "But, young man, do you not realize that there are miles and miles of beach and there are starfish all along every mile? You can't possibly make a difference!"
At this, the young man bent down, picked up yet another starfish, and threw it into the ocean. As it met the water, he said, "It made a difference for that one."

lender.occupational_info:
U.S. Census Bureau Technical Assistance and Capacity Building International Assistance Area
In this position, I work on reimbursable projects in developing countries, which directly contributes to the Census Bureau's core mission, “sharing our expertise globally.” This is accomplished by providing technical assistance and training to build statistical capacity worldwide. As a result of this effort many countries now have data to use for critical policy making decisions.
*Project Lead: Interagency Census Coordination Project lead for the Interagency Census Coordination Committee meetings, which provides a forum for technical assistance agencies such as the United Nations Population Fund and the U.S. Agency for International Development. I am responsible for implementing future committee meetings, tentatively scheduled for 2008, which bring international donor organizations together for coordinating efforts in ensuring that developing countries have a successful round of 2010 censuses.
*Marketing Coordinator: International Assistance Area Tasked with creating a series of informational literature to distribute among potential sponsors, host countries, and other technical assistance agencies to highlight the importance of taking censuses and using census data for policy making decisions.
*Geographic Information Systems Expert: Sudan Census Project Assisting the Southern Sudanese government by providing Geographic Information System expertise to develop maps for use in the upcoming census of Sudan. These are the first maps for this area of the country and are necessary to ensure an accurate count of the country’s population.

lender.name: Suki
lender.loan_because: To give opportunity is to give hope. Without hope we have nothing.
lender.occupational_info: I am a pilot for a commercial airline in the United States flying passengers.

lender.name: Yvonne

lender.occupational_info: I am a 6th grade social studies teacher.

lender.name: Troy
lender.loan_because:
I greatly admire Kiva.org - I think it's one of the most powerful tools that have come from the information age. Fully utilizing the extensive reach of the internet, Kiva.org has the ability to monetarily connect anyone in the world to a small business in an impoverished country.
While a $800 loan to a small business may seem inadequate here in America, to a small business in a destitute country, it could be the difference as to whether they can afford medicine or food for their family. It could be all the difference to their employee's and their family. It could also be all the difference to their community.
The greater and long term impact of helping a small business grow reaches far beyond the the business itself.
lender.occupational_info:
I am a co-founder of an internet marketing company called CPAlead.com. We provide unique and innovative online marketing tools to small and big website owners from all over the world.
These ad display tools generate our clients revenues much greater than traditional online marketing networks. We have helped over 150,000 people monetize their website's and as a result we were recently ranked the #1 fastest growing online marketing start-up by INC 500 magazine.
To learn more about CPAlead, please visit http://www.youtube.com/cpalead

lender.occupational_info: I read textbooks to look for grammar and spelling mistakes. I help authors arrange their written words in a way that makes sense to their readers.

lender.name: Claudia
lender.loan_because: Micro loans are a good way to go for developping poor countries. No corruption, high moral by those applying for loans og motivated people who really does big affords and approaches to succeed with their work. To support small businesses means much to the local societies. Actually, I belive that micro loans are more powerful for fighting against poverty than most of the money given for "developping" poor people and countries by industrialized countries. But Fairtrade is even more important!
lender.occupational_info: I'm a civil servant working with business steering by strategy, controlling, qualityprooving and economics in a big organisation.

lender.name: Sandra&Mickeal
lender.loan_because: We would like to help other entrepreneurs furfill thier dreams just as others helped us with ours.
lender.occupational_info: Sandra is an Information Technology Manager of a Western Canadian Accounting Firm and Mickeal is a Program Manager for a Avionics Firm in Canada

lender.name: Charlotte
lender.loan_because: I know how hard it is to get ahead when you have a dream and a lot of people have helped me along the way. It's time to return the favor.
lender.occupational_info: I am an actor some of the time and a paralegal the rest of the time. One job pays the bills and the other is what I've always wanted to do.

lender.name: Charles & Rosalba
lender.loan_because: Everyone should be given a chance to succeed and money shouldn't be the obstacle for that success.

lender.name: Kenneth
lender.loan_because: I want to help those in need.

lender.name: Jack
lender.loan_because: It's nice to try and "undo" some of the damage my government has done to people in foreign countries.
lender.occupational_info: I teach people to meditate and I am a therapist.

lender.name: Christine
lender.loan_because: Helping people makes me feel better about the world we live in, and knowing that we can all help is amazing.
lender.occupational_info: I am a student at UBC, in Vancouver BC. I am taking biology, in hopes of heading in to the environmental sector.

lender.occupational_info: I work in the transportation industry, providing trucks that move products across the country.

lender.name: AmoebaCorp
lender.loan_because: change is for the entrepreneurial mind.
lender.occupational_info: We are creative problem solvers and entrepreneurs that believe in the power of service for humanity... when we help one we help all.

lender.name: Martin
lender.loan_because: I teach a course in Economic Development and, in the class, we discuss strategies for reducing extreme poverty in the world. Microcredit financing is one of the most proven ways of accomplishing that goal. God bless your work.

lender.name: Lawson Culver
lender.loan_because: What seems like a very little of money to me can be life-changing for someone else

lender.name: Cindy
lender.loan_because: I can

lender.name: Katherine
lender.loan_because: “If you want to like yourself, lift up someone else.” (Booker T. Washington)
lender.occupational_info: Currently helping a museum move its collections into a new facility.

lender.name: Casey McKinnon
lender.loan_because: I've been fortunate in my life and feel it's important to encourage the world that anyone can accomplish great things when given the opportunity.
lender.occupational_info: I make short TV shows you can watch on the internet.

lender.name: Diane
lender.loan_because: I think it's a great idea to help someone who wants to improve the quality of their life.

lender.name: Chris
lender.loan_because: This is an amazing way to make a small difference in the world.

lender.name: Richard

lender.name: Sam & Kate

lender.name: Rachel
lender.loan_because: I believe all people should be given the opportunity to thrive.

lender.name: Denise
lender.loan_because: The thought that I might be able to make a difference in a person's life, someone that I can actually see and know (at least a little bit!), who is halfway around the world from me, is so exciting.

lender.name: Gail
lender.loan_because: the idea of helping others seems to be a dying concept in our modern society. But perhaps that will change with all those giving people who support Kiva.
lender.occupational_info: Rewarding, and challenging.

lender.name: Denice
lender.loan_because: We're all connected, when we reach out to someone it creates ripples of good will that will heal the world. I can't do a lot but I can create a ripple.
lender.occupational_info: I am the founder of Ubasti, Inc. Our mission is to support and celebrate women who strive to overcome adversity to improve their lives or the lives of others. To learn more please visit our website.

lender.name: Katie
lender.loan_because: I recently started an online shop selling my arts and crafts, and I vowed to myself that as soon as I made $25, I would give it back (in a way!) by loaning it to another businessperson.

lender.occupation: Manager in a customer service centre
lender.loan_because: Every little bit counts!

lender.occupational_info: I study political science and run a small non-profit organization that runs programs on environmental sustainability, darfur education and volunteering abroad.

lender.name: Cathrine
lender.loan_because: Scripture tells us this is the right thing to do and it does so much. It is a way of reminding us that we CAN all help and a little can have a large impact.

lender.name: Stephanie
lender.loan_because: I have been very blessed in life and can think of no better way to give back than to help others who have such a strong desire to change their lives. Every little bit makes a huge difference.

lender.name: Nicholas
lender.loan_because: I know it is my duty to help out those in need, and i love to hear the success stories.
lender.occupational_info: I go to school full time. I will soon be working in Law

lender.name: HollyElle
lender.loan_because: Jesus taught us that everybody deserves a chance!
lender.occupational_info: I (Holly) am learning to become a teacher, and Elle is learning about International Relations.

lender.name: Dennis
lender.loan_because: It is an amazing way to have an impact in the life of someone you have never meet that may live half way around the world for a very small amount of money to us, but a great sum to them.

lender.name: Kira
lender.loan_because: It works and inspires.

lender.name: Grant and Elliot
lender.loan_because: we knew Mr. Chuon needed more money for his Hog and his gaming set up in the back
lender.occupational_info: Leveling

lender.name: Carri
lender.loan_because: I can.

lender.name: Asten
lender.loan_because: I believe that people who are willing to work hard and support themselves and their community should have access to the resources to do so.
lender.occupational_info: I lead teams that design wireless communications products

lender.name: Ysmaelle
lender.loan_because: I want to make a difference in the world. I want to help someone in need. I'm blessed enough to do so. It is God's will.

lender.name: Julius John
lender.whereabouts: Cagayan de Oro City Misamis Oriental
lender.loan_because: Hello everyone, Im Julius from the philippines and ive been to college for 7 years, Im good in math and a computer literate. I graduate at march 2005 and my course is BS-Electronics and Communications Engineering thats why i stayed long in college maybe im not that smart. But i believe that hardwork surpasses genuis, this phrase keeps telling me that giving up is not an option. Finally I graduated, yet Parents' whining is not yet over. My next goal is to pass the Board exam to be a licensed ece engineer. It's the hardest part of my life since im not really that smart especially reading lots of books because we Filipinos have different language. I failed my first take on my board exam, my parents were so angry, but still they have hope in me then given me a chance for the second time, and still i failed, and i tot it is the end of the world, luckily my parents have positive attitude toward it because what they saw was that my average score improved from 64% to 68% because the average passing grade is 70%. I was so depressed and i tot will not gonna make it, maybe i need more motivation and here comes another problem that came before i took my 3rd time board exam. My girlfriend is 2 months pregnant and i have 2 months left to study and review b4 my 3rd take of board exam starts. I keep it secret to my parents, now that i have one problem i always thought what will happen if i fail and they know that my girlfriend is pregnant, i need to come up with a good solution to this problem, i slept 6 hours a day for me to have lots of study time and i dedicated my life on studying just to pass the board exam and i always thought what future i could give to my baby if i wont make it this time and what would my parents do to me. Im so scared and pressured and my parents always reminding me that im 26 and still worthless. I never stop believing in God and myself, i feel that i can make it. Thanks to God my younger brother woke us up 2am in the morning at april 2007 to announce that i passed the board exam, my parents were so happy that they cant even wait to buy a news paper, yet i was so uncomfortable with the environment because cos i still have to confess to them that my gf is pregnant. Same that day at 6pm i approached my mom and said my girlfriend is pregnant. My parents both cried, they told me that you even did not let this day of hapiness passed. I gave them hapiness in the morning and sadness in the evening. I feel very sorry for what did. But sadness were paid of when my baby andrea came out, she's very cute and healhty yet hospital bills were P45,000 or $1,100 when it's converted to USD. I owe that to my parents since i dont have a job. I found a job after 7 months with a P8,000 salary or $200 per month which is enough only for one person so ill have to budget it just to fit for the three of us. My girlfriend is stil in school so im the one responsible for the expenses of my baby and even to some of her needs. I saved money during my 2 mos of work and i used it to baptizm of my baby last dec30. Right now im saving for our wedding which i think i need a long time for me to save enough for marriage. Before we use to own an internet cafe for 5 yrs yet technology rise faster and our computer cant catch up new games specificaition and new policies were implemented that all internet cafe must have a license on all of their software. We were busy that time. Cafe just last from 2001 to 2005 only. Maybe it's one of the reasons why i get low grades. And my parents wanted to close it to focus on my board exam. My parent's plan went well that why i passed the board exam. I always think also to help some street children here in our country but dont have the money to do that. All i can give is give my old clothes. If i come up with this $10,000 USD or more ill restore our internet cafe. Im fully equiped with knowledge on running this internet cafe yet dont have a capital to start the business. Im asking everyone to help me achieve my goal to give my family a better future and to help street children in our country as well. Id be willing to share my blessing to those who need it the most. I would love to be used as an instrument to help others as well. Here is my paypal account: juliusgatinao@yahoo.com Help me make my dream come true. I hope those who have enough blessings may share it with me. Thank you and God Bless you. About me: I work as a technical support staff in a business company who sells routers, switches, computers and other high end telecomunication products. Right now im planing to run a business to change my life and help others. I can do offline typing jobs for you just to raise this fund. Hard to find better job here in the Philippines.
lender.occupational_info: I work as a technical support staff in a business company who sells routers, switches, computers and other high end telecomunication products. Right now im planing to run a business to change my life and help others.

I want to make a difference.
DO MORE!

lender.occupational_info: I work on eradicating human trafficking. I believe no human being should be bought or sold by another.

lender.name: Karen

lender.name: Jenifer

lender.name: Jennifer Sewards
lender.loan_because: A man's ethical behavior should be based effectually on sympathy, education, and social ties; no religious basis is necessary. Man would indeed be in a poor way if he had to be restrained by fear of punishment and hope of reward after death. (Albert Einstein) http://www.the-brights.net/

lender.loan_because: We have enough and loans can change lives.

One of my greatest rewards is being able to nurture, encourage and support youth achieve their dreams and reach their full potential; being able to positively contribute to their lives and the arts.
